Close top ad Immortal (Legacy of the Void) ============================= From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki _This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For other versions see [Immortal (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)](/starcraft2/Immortal_(Wings_of_Liberty_and_Heart_of_the_Swarm) "Immortal (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)") and [Immortal (Legacy of the Void Campaign)](/starcraft2/Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void_Campaign) "Immortal (Legacy of the Void Campaign)") ._ \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_%28Legacy_of_the_Void%29&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ \]![Protoss](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/0/0f/Protoss_race_icon.png/30px-Protoss_race_icon.png%20%22Protoss%22) Immortal [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/ee/SC2Immortal.jpg/600px-SC2Immortal.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Immortal.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/ee/SC2Immortal.jpg/600px-SC2Immortal.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Immortal.jpg) Unit Information Type: Ground Unit Description: Assault strider. Can use Barrier to absorb damage. Built From: [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility "Robotics Facility") Cost: [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")  275 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/2/2e/Vespene-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas")  100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Buildtime_protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")  39 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply")  4 [Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race") : I Attack 1: Phase Disruptors Targets: Ground Damage: 20 (+2) [DPS](/starcraft2/Damage_Per_Second "Damage Per Second") : 19.2 (+1.92) [Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown") : 1.04 Bonus: +30 (+3) vs [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") Bonus DPS: +28.9 (+2.9) vs [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") [Range](/starcraft2/Range "Range") : 6 Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 200 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/82/Icon_Shields.png)](/starcraft2/Plasma_Shield "Plasma Shield") 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 1 (+1) Attributes: [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") , [Mechanical](/starcraft2/Mechanical "Mechanical") Sight: 9 Speed: 3.15 Cargo size: 4 Strong against: * [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") * [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") * [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") Weak against: * [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") * [Zealot](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") * [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") Contents -------- * [1 Description](#Description) * [2 Abilities](#Abilities) * [3 Competitive Usage](#Competitive_Usage) * [3.1 General](#General) * [3.2 Vs. Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [3.3 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [3.4 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [4 Gallery](#Gallery) * [5 Quotes](#Quotes) * [6 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [7 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Immortal** is a durable ranged, mechanized strider for the [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") army, produced at the [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility "Robotics Facility") . Their [Barrier](/starcraft2/Barrier "Barrier") ability makes them specialists at taking damage. Additionally, they have a powerful anti-armour attack making them capable against high-power units such as [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") and [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") . Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Barrier](/starcraft2/Barrier "Barrier") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/c/cc/Barrier.png/62px-Barrier.png)](/starcraft2/File:Barrier.png) | **Caster:** Immortal

**[Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown")
:** 32 s

**[Duration](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")
:** 2 s

Absorbs up to 100 damage while blocking the first instance of damage. Lasts for 2 seconds. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=3 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: General")\ \] The Immortal has succeeded the [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") as the premier Anchor unit of the Robotics Facility since the release of Legacy of the Void, due to a variety of reasons. For the Immortal's part, the reworked Barrier ability made them durable against a far wider variety of attacks. Immortals relate well to other Protoss units. [Warp Prisms](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") can now help move Immortals safely in and out of range to devastating effect, as used by [HerO](/starcraft2/HerO "HerO") in tournaments - against [Life](/starcraft2/Life "Life") in the [IPL Tournament of Champions](/starcraft2/IPL_Tournament_of_Champions "IPL Tournament of Champions") and against [Jaedong](/starcraft2/Jaedong "Jaedong") at [IEM Season VIII - Cologne](/starcraft2/IEM_Season_VIII_-_Cologne "IEM Season VIII - Cologne") , one of his Immortals recorded over 40 kills. Compared to the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") , Immortals now have the same DPS per cost against non-armored units ([![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals") 275 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/8c/Vespene-terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas") 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply") 4 vs [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals") 250 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/8c/Vespene-terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas") 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply") 4 for two Stalkers, with both providing about 19 DPS). The choice between the two is determined by a trade-off between Immortal's larger anti-armor bonus and the Stalker's anti-air and mobility capabilities ([Blink](/starcraft2/Blink "Blink") and remote warp-in). In small numbers, Immortals are particularly effective support against [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") , [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") and [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") as armored units during the early game. Even so, larger numbers of Immortals are highly useful against higher-tech armored units into the late game, especially key targets like burrowed [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") or [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") . ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] Immortals deal a large amount of damage to [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") and [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossi "Colossi") , but are quite ineffective against enemy [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") . [Zealot](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") /Immortal vs [Zealot](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") /[Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossi "Colossi") battles generally revolve around the Immortal user trying to snipe the opponent's [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") before they are able to do too much damage. However, if [Extended Thermal Lances](/starcraft2/Extended_Thermal_Lances "Extended Thermal Lances") is researched, the player with 9-range Colossi retains a large range advantage over the 6-range Immortals and often can position his Colossi to avoid Immortal fire while still attacking. Against Stalkers, an un-upgraded Immortal will take 4 shots to kill a Stalker, however with +1 Weapons, an Immortal needs only 3. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] Immortals are incredibly effective against small numbers of sieged [Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") due to their slow rate of fire, and do quite well against other armored units such as [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") . Like when fighting Stalkers, an un-upgraded Immortal will take 4 shots to kill a Siege Tank; with +1 Weapons, an Immortal needs only 3. Immortals are also effective against [Thors](/starcraft2/Thor "Thor") , having similar effective HP but much more attack per supply. Two Immortals in a [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") may be dropped into a Terran base to destroy SCVs. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] The use of early Immortals depends on the Zerg's strategy. They are less effective against [Hydralisks](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") and [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") and are unable to attack [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") , and thus have little use against Zerg armies that largely consist of these units. Conversely, Immortals are strongly cost-effective against [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") due to their 50 base damage against armored units and +2 range advantage over Roaches. Do note that just because Immortals counter Roaches does not mean that it's black and white, as their economic costs and production system are very different. [GAMETIME](/starcraft2/GAMETIME "GAMETIME") a 6k MMR Zerg player has been known to take wins against Protoss players with mass Roach timings, meaning when they hit early enough, Immortals alone aren't enough. [Sentries](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") are excellent additions when defending these timings as forcefields can deny Roaches the ability to walk up to the Immortal and attack. Towards the midgame, Immortals are not a unit a Protoss player should avoid. Even if the opponent starts without any Roaches or [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") , producing Immortals preemptively denies the transition for the Zerg player due to their bonus against armor, which is particuarly important in protecting the Protoss from a Lurker switch. For example, Hydralisk-based armies tend to transition into Lurkers making the Immortal necessary. Keep in mind that they also shut down [Ultralisk](/starcraft2/Ultralisk "Ultralisk") transitions, which are another example of an armored unit. Gallery\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Gallery")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/7/74/Immortal.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Immortal.gif) Quotes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Quotes")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | \[[hide](#)

html:
Immortal (Legacy of the Void)

From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki
This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For other versions see Immortal (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm) and Immortal (Legacy of the Void Campaign).
[e][h] Immortal
Unit Information
Type:
Ground Unit
Description:
Assault strider. Can use Barrier to absorb damage.
Built From:
Robotics Facility
Cost:
 275  100  39  4
Hotkey:
I
Attack 1: Phase Disruptors
Targets:
Ground
Damage:
20 (+2)
DPS:
19.2 (+1.92)
Cooldown:
1.04
Bonus:
+30 (+3) vs Armored
Bonus DPS:
+28.9 (+2.9) vs Armored
Range:
6
Unit stats
Defense:
200 100 1 (+1)
Attributes:
Armored, Mechanical
Sight:
9
Speed:
3.15
Cargo size:
4
Strong against:
  • Siege Tank
  • Stalker
  • Roach
Weak against:
  • Marine
  • Zealot
  • Zergling

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Abilities
  • 3 Competitive Usage
    • 3.1 General
    • 3.2 Vs. Protoss
    • 3.3 Vs. Terran
    • 3.4 Vs. Zerg
  • 4 Gallery
  • 5 Quotes
  • 6 Patch Changes
  • 7 References

Description[edit]

The Immortal is a durable ranged, mechanized strider for the Protoss army, produced at the Robotics Facility. Their Barrier ability makes them specialists at taking damage. Additionally, they have a powerful anti-armour attack making them capable against high-power units such as Siege Tanks and Lurkers.

Abilities[edit]

Barrier
Caster: Immortal
Cooldown: 32 s
Duration: 2 s
Absorbs up to 100 damage while blocking the first instance of damage. Lasts for 2 seconds.

Competitive Usage[edit]

General[edit]

The Immortal has succeeded the Colossi as the premier Anchor unit of the Robotics Facility since the release of Legacy of the Void, due to a variety of reasons. For the Immortal's part, the reworked Barrier ability made them durable against a far wider variety of attacks.

Immortals relate well to other Protoss units. Warp Prisms can now help move Immortals safely in and out of range to devastating effect, as used by HerO in tournaments - against Life in the IPL Tournament of Champions and against Jaedong at IEM Season VIII - Cologne, one of his Immortals recorded over 40 kills. Compared to the Stalker, Immortals now have the same DPS per cost against non-armored units (275 100 4 vs 250 100 4 for two Stalkers, with both providing about 19 DPS). The choice between the two is determined by a trade-off between Immortal's larger anti-armor bonus and the Stalker's anti-air and mobility capabilities (Blink and remote warp-in).

In small numbers, Immortals are particularly effective support against Stalkers, Roaches and Marauders as armored units during the early game. Even so, larger numbers of Immortals are highly useful against higher-tech armored units into the late game, especially key targets like burrowed Lurkers or Siege Tanks.

Vs. Protoss[edit]

Immortals deal a large amount of damage to Stalkers and Colossi, but are quite ineffective against enemy Zealots. Zealot/Immortal vs Zealot/Colossi battles generally revolve around the Immortal user trying to snipe the opponent's Colossi before they are able to do too much damage. However, if Extended Thermal Lances is researched, the player with 9-range Colossi retains a large range advantage over the 6-range Immortals and often can position his Colossi to avoid Immortal fire while still attacking.

Against Stalkers, an un-upgraded Immortal will take 4 shots to kill a Stalker, however with +1 Weapons, an Immortal needs only 3.

Vs. Terran[edit]

Immortals are incredibly effective against small numbers of sieged Tanks due to their slow rate of fire, and do quite well against other armored units such as Marauders. Like when fighting Stalkers, an un-upgraded Immortal will take 4 shots to kill a Siege Tank; with +1 Weapons, an Immortal needs only 3.

Immortals are also effective against Thors, having similar effective HP but much more attack per supply.

Two Immortals in a Warp Prism may be dropped into a Terran base to destroy SCVs.

Vs. Zerg[edit]

The use of early Immortals depends on the Zerg's strategy. They are less effective against Hydralisks and Zerglings and are unable to attack Mutalisks, and thus have little use against Zerg armies that largely consist of these units. Conversely, Immortals are strongly cost-effective against Roaches due to their 50 base damage against armored units and +2 range advantage over Roaches. Do note that just because Immortals counter Roaches does not mean that it's black and white, as their economic costs and production system are very different. GAMETIME a 6k MMR Zerg player has been known to take wins against Protoss players with mass Roach timings, meaning when they hit early enough, Immortals alone aren't enough. Sentries are excellent additions when defending these timings as forcefields can deny Roaches the ability to walk up to the Immortal and attack.

Towards the midgame, Immortals are not a unit a Protoss player should avoid. Even if the opponent starts without any Roaches or Lurkers, producing Immortals preemptively denies the transition for the Zerg player due to their bonus against armor, which is particuarly important in protecting the Protoss from a Lurker switch. For example, Hydralisk-based armies tend to transition into Lurkers making the Immortal necessary. Keep in mind that they also shut down Ultralisk transitions, which are another example of an armored unit.

Gallery[edit]

Quotes[edit]

[hide][show]Quotes
Built Selected Annoyed Move Attack Under Attack
  • I return to serve.
  • I heed the call.
  • I feel your presence.
  • Bo'tharus Shien.
  • Glory is eternal.
  • Our duty is unending.
  • Bon'dara Malahkai.
  • We shall serve forever.
  • My memory is not what it was.
  • These steel limbs are not my own.
  • I have known only an eternity of war.
  • I am the wrath of the Khala!
  • There can be only one. [q 1]
  • Back in my day, I had to teleport, to and from school, in the snow, uphill both dimensions!
  • Youth is wasted on the young.
  • Where's my walker!? Oh.. I'm in it.
  • The second thing to go is your memory... I can't remember what the first thing is.
  • It is destined.
  • It shall be.
  • There shall be a reckoning.
  • Khala Dora.
  • Our cannons shall sing.
  • We march to victory!
  • For the ancients!
  • Let darkness be parted.
  • En Taro Adun!
  • Woe to our enemies!
  • Fury unyielding.
  • Bea'kûl Sairn.
  • The battle is ours!
  • The enemy closes!
  1. ↑ from Highlander

Immortal's quotes (video and sound) - YouTube video.

Patch Changes[edit]

[hide][show]Patch 2.5.1 Balance Update #1 [1]
  • Immortal barrier ability now absorbs 200 (up from 100).
[hide][show]Patch 3.3.0 Balance Update [2]
  • Barrier absorb reduced from 200 damage to 100 damage
[hide][show]Patch 3.8.0 Balance Update [3]
  • "Barrier" is now a passive ability, and its cooldown is reduced from 43 to 32.
[hide][show]Patch 4.8.2 [4]
  • Cost increased from 250/100 to 275/100.
[hide][show]Patch 5.0.12 [5]
  • Barrier will now also block the first instance of damage which triggers the Barrier.

References[edit]

  1. ↑ Blizzard Entertainment (15 April 2015). "Legacy of the Void Beta Balance Update -- April 15, 2015". Battle.net.
  2. ↑ Blizzard Entertainment (23 May 2016). "Legacy of the Void Balance Update -- May 23, 2016". Battle.net.
  3. ↑ Blizzard Entertainment (8 December 2016). "Legacy of the Void Balance Update -- December 8, 2016". Battle.net.
  4. ↑ Blizzard Entertainment (22 January 2019). "STARCRAFT II 4.8.2 PATCH NOTES". Battle.net.
  5. ↑ Blizzard Entertainment (29 September 2023). "StarCraft II 5.0.12 Patch Notes". Battle.net.
